meanings.definition: A tendency to do nothing or to remain unchanged.
meanings.sent1: Her inertia prevented her from starting the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rock's inertia kept it still on the ground.
meanings.sent3: Despite her inertia, she managed to finish the race.
meanings.sent4: The inertia of the old traditions was hard to overcome.
meanings.sent5: The inertia of the sleepy cat made it hard to wake up.

meanings.sent1: The car's inertia made it difficult to push uphill.
meanings.sent2: The pond's water showed no signs of inertia as the ducks swam.
meanings.sent3: The inertia of the quiet library was suddenly broken by a loud sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The inertia of the market was disrupted by the sudden influx of customers.
meanings.sent5: The inertia of the sleeping dog was disturbed by a loud noise.
